items.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

items.title: Mukul Agrawal reshapes Rs 6,500-crore portfolio in Q3: Two new stocks, one exit. Do you own?

These include Osel Devices, Zelio E-Mobility, Monolithisch India, Zota Health Care, and ASM Technologies.

items.summary: Indian basmati rice exporters like LT Foods and KRBL are under scrutiny following a US announcement of a 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran. items.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO Day 3: GMP at 46%; issue sees strong subscription. Should you apply?
items.summary: Bharat Coking Coal's IPO is seeing robust demand. The issue is attracting strong interest in the grey market, indicating positive investor sentiment. Experts recommend subscribing for potential listing gains.

items.title: View: Why India’s big nuclear bet is going to need much more than just capital
items.summary: Nuclear SHANTI law: India tends to build sectors first and regulate them later. With nuclear power, it must do both together. It will save billions by allowing the private sector in, but it must also spend billions on independent laboratories, well-paid inspectors, and real-time monitoring.

items.title: Should you buy TCS after Q3 results? Brokerages explain
items.summary: TCS share price: JP Morgan maintained an overweight rating and raised its target price to Rs 4,200 from Rs 4,100.

items.title: Ola Electric shares surge 3% as company rolls out first BESS product ‘Shakti’
items.summary: Ola Electric shares: The company launched its first residential Battery Energy Storage System, Shakti, from its Krishnagiri Gigafactory, marking its entry into the residential BESS market. Powered by locally developed 4680 Bharat Cells, the product is India’s first of its kind and is designed to provide portable, on-demand energy solutions for households, farms, and businesses.

items.title: Value buys? Worst-performing India market pushes 25 Nifty stocks below 5-year PE
items.summary: India's stock market faces challenges, with 25 major Nifty companies now trading below their five-year average price-to-earnings ratios. This valuation shift follows a period of global uncertainty and foreign investor selling. Investors are closely watching upcoming earnings reports to determine if growth justifies current valuations. Market volatility is expected to continue as global factors influence sentiment.

items.title: Shapewear finds its fit as India’s fashion brands chase steady support
items.summary: As brands search for steadier demand drivers, shapewear is being positioned as a functional extension of innerwear rather than a fashion-led bet. But, players still face hurdles around fit, pricing, and consumer behaviour that could determine whether the category scales sustainably or remains niche.

items.title: Why the next phase of global investing may go beyond the US, says Alekh Yadav of Sanctum Wealth
items.summary: US equity markets have seen strong gains driven by Big Tech and AI. However, valuations are now stretched, with risks building around debt-funded investments and AI revenue growth. Geopolitical tensions also add to market volatility. Experts suggest investors should look beyond the US and diversify their international exposure for future growth opportunities.

items.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
items.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

items.title: Earnings outlook stabilising despite volatility; autos, financials, telecom in focus: Axis MF’s Karthik Kumar
items.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Karthik Kumar says recent market volatility is driven by global uncertainty and FII selling, but earnings trends are stabilising. He sees valuations normalising and expects growth-led sectors to regain leadership. Autos, financials, telecom and industrials remain key overweight bets, while IT and discretionary consumption need earnings confirmation to turn positive.

items.title: TCS shares slip marginally after Q3 profit drops 14% YoY. What should investors do?
items.summary: Tata Consultancy Services reported a year-on-year decline in Q3FY26 profit despite steady revenue growth, driven by one-off costs and wage hikes. Brokerages remain cautious but constructive, citing stable margins, improving demand visibility and growing AI-led deal traction, while largely recommending a neutral-to-positive stance on the stock.

items.title: HCL Tech shares jump nearly 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: HCL Tech shares: The IT services firm reported an 11% year-on-year decline in consolidated net profit to ₹4,076 crore in the December quarter, even as revenue grew strongly. Revenue from operations rose 13% YoY to ₹33,872 crore, while on a sequential basis profit fell nearly 4% and revenue increased 6% compared to the September quarter.

items.summary: Meesho is entering the logistics business by incorporating a new subsidiary. This move is expected to be a key driver for the company's future earnings. BofA Securities has initiated coverage with a Neutral rating, setting a price target of Rs 190. The stock is trading above its IPO price, showing investor interest. This expansion signals Meesho's strategic growth plans.

items.title: India’s debt fund managers turn tactical as returns get harder
items.summary: India's top debt fund managers are adopting a cautious stance for the year ahead, prioritizing stability and accrual over long-term bets. With the central bank nearing the end of its rate-cut cycle and investor demand subdued, strategies are shifting towards higher cash holdings, state bonds, and shorter corporate debt for better opportunities.

items.title: Anand Rathi shares rally 2% as Q3 net profit jumps 30% to Rs 100 crore

Assets Under Management grew 30% to Rs 99,008 crore. The firm added new clients and saw healthy inflows, demonstrating steady growth.

items.title: China examines foreign ETF trades after Jane Street India probe
items.summary: China is examining how foreign firms like Jane Street Group operate in its large ETF market. Regulators want to understand trading activities. This comes after India accused Jane Street of market manipulation. UBS has paused some trades from Jane Street. China's stock market is sensitive to performance. Foreign firms are increasingly active in China's growing ETF sector.

items.title: Trump announces 25% tariff on countries doing business with Iran — what it means for India
items.summary: President Trump has imposed a new 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran, effective immediately. For India, this adds to existing levies, potentially raising total US tariffs on Indian goods to 75%. The move threatens a $2.33 billion trade relationship and strategic ties, such as Chabahar Port.

items.title: TCS, HCLTech deliver Q3 revenue surprise amid labour cost headwinds
items.summary: Both Tata Consultancy Services and HCL Technologies beat analyst revenue estimates and kicked off the earnings season on a stronger-than-expected note, despite new wage norms pushing up costs and raising concerns over profitability.

items.title: MAGA deal in making: US resumes trade talks with ‘real friend’ India
items.summary: US Ambassador designate Sergio Gor announced that trade pact discussions with India will resume Tuesday, aiming to resolve differences beyond tariffs. He emphasised the strong personal relationship between Trump and Modi, highlighting the partnership's significance beyond trade, encompassing security, technology, and energy cooperation.

items.title: Apollo Hospitals demerger is a biz call taken for shareholders, says Suneeta Reddy; rules out family rift
items.summary: Apollo Hospitals MD Suneeta Reddy says the group’s restructuring is about business strategy, not family dynamics, aiming to unlock value by separating hospital and pharmacy-digital units. She stresses close ties with sister Shobana Kamineni, outlines expansion in metros and Tier-II cities, focus on preventive care, tech-led growth and mentoring next generation of leaders.

items.title: Ex-Lazard Banker’s Insider Tips Reaped $41 Million Haul, US Says
items.summary: A former dealmaker at Lazard Ltd., one of Wall Street’s most prominent investment banks, is accused by US authorities of feeding tips on health-care deals to a friend’s network of insider traders, who generated $41 million of illicit profits.

items.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is lending Altice USA an additional roughly $1.1 billion to refinance debt before an early repayment penalty kicks in, a move that may sooth creditors still reeling from a bombshell antitrust lawsuit and controversial debt maneuver.

items.title: India may tweak e-car manufacturing SOP scheme to woo global firms
items.summary: Officials are evaluating changes to the Scheme to Promote Manufacturing of Electric Passenger Cars in India (SPMEPCI), which relies primarily on import duty concessions, including the introduction of more direct incentives, to entice global premium EV makers to establish manufacturing bases in India.

items.title: Paramount files lawsuit against Warner Bros over $82.7B Netflix deal – Latest updates & key developments
items.summary: Paramount Skydance has intensified its bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, filing a lawsuit over the studio’s $82.7 billion merger with Netflix.

items.title: US tariff pressures push British Columbia to boost India trade
items.summary: Canadian province's premier David Eby, who is leading a trade mission to India from January 12-17, told ET in an interview that the province is trying to develop more opportunities with India to diversify trade, which has been hit by the US tariffs.

items.title: Net direct tax mopup rises 8.8% till January 11
items.summary: Despite a slower pace of tax refunds, the growth in collection was much below the budgeted 12.7% increase for the entire 2025-26. With less than three months left in this fiscal, experts are cautiously optimistic about meeting the budget target of ₹25.20 lakh crore.

items.title: Retail inflation hits 3-month high of 1.3% in December
items.summary: In December 2025, retail inflation climbed to 1.3%, rising from November's 0.7%, setting a new three-month peak. While this increase remains shy of the central bank's goal, the easing of food deflation contrasted with the uptick in prices for various goods.

items.title: Banks bank on cash recyclers in new ATM cycle
items.summary: Indian banks are set to deploy nearly 17,350 ATMs in the coming months. A significant majority of these will be advanced cash recyclers. This move signals a shift towards modern technology for better efficiency and lower costs. Banks are prioritizing smarter machines that reduce cash handling needs and improve service availability.

items.title: Shriram-MUFG deal may test rules on non-compete fee for promoters
items.summary: Japan's MUFG Bank's $4.4 billion investment in Shriram Finance includes an unusual $200 million non-compete fee to the promoter, Shriram Ownership Trust. This payment, potentially setting a precedent, has raised questions about equitable treatment for all shareholders as the promoter retains control.

items.title: Braskem Makes Coupon Payment Amid Ongoing Debt Review
items.summary: Braskem SA, one of the world’s largest petrochemical makers, paid interest due Monday on some of its dollar bonds, people familiar with the matter said, easing investor concerns while it continues to review its debt amid a prolonged industry downturn.

items.title: Distribution costs weigh on value of insurance products
items.summary: Insurance product value is shrinking due to high commissions and operating expenses. Experts highlight concerns with credit-linked life, non-linked, motor third-party, and retail health policies. Despite tax reforms, these costs impact customer returns. Industry growth has stagnated while expenses climb. A committee is now examining distribution costs.

items.title: Green line glitch solution turns into a tax headache for OnePlus
items.summary: OnePlus is facing a significant tax demand from GST authorities for its lifetime screen replacement warranty. This comes as the company's sales and profits saw a sharp decline in the last fiscal year. The company is contesting the demand, asserting confidence in a favorable outcome. Other tax notices totaling ₹280 crore have also been received.

items.title: Profitable growth drove Mahindra & Mahindra to 2nd position: Top exec
items.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra is now India's second-largest passenger vehicle maker. This position is a result of their focus on profitable growth and smart capital use. The company is not chasing volumes alone. They are planning to expand their utility vehicle capacity significantly by FY27. New plant locations are being explored across various states to meet this future demand.

items.title: Production companies bet on confirmed OTT deals to hit the fund trail
items.summary: Indian film and entertainment production houses are changing how they get money. They now raise funds against confirmed deals with streaming services and TV channels. This new approach helps producers get working capital faster. It also offers investors a less risky way to fund content. Structured credit platforms are making financing quicker and cheaper for producers across India.

items.title: Green energy projects get more time to commission projects
items.summary: Renewable energy projects facing delays due to Supreme Court rulings on Great Indian Bustard habitats will now receive deadline extensions. The government has recognized these delays as unavoidable. This decision impacts projects requiring overhead power transmission lines in Rajasthan and Gujarat.

items.title: Wedding trousseaus to bear the brunt of gold, silver price surge

Investors are buying gold and silver bars as safe-haven assets. Jewellers report a significant drop in wedding jewellery demand, with consumers opting for lower caratage gold or lighter pieces to manage budgets.

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.
